North_Little_Rock.Daisy Bates House: The Daisy Bates House is a historic house at 1207 West 28th Street in Little Rock, Arkansas. It is significant as the home of Arkansas NAACP president Daisy Bates, and for its use as a command post for those working to desegregrate the Little Rock Central High School during the desegregation crisis of 1957–1958. It was a sanctuary for the nine students involved.
